newsitem.title: UK: NWE gasoline softer in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: NWE gasoline softer in thin trade.

text.p: NWE gasoline prices were a touch softer on Thursday with buying interest thin and public holidays across much of Europe further dulling trade, dealers said.
On the key ARA barge market Eurograde prices started steady but drifted down $1 as sellers found little buying interest.
Eurograde barges talked $192/$194 with weaker forward sentiment reflected in a narrowing May/June contango, down to around 50 cents from $1.50 a tonne at start of the week.
June swaps saw some interest to trade around 50 cents firmer at $193.25 and $193.50 a tonne fob ARA.
Selling was seen out of Germany at around $202 but buyers stayed $2 below this.
